description: Application for variation of planning condition 2 of planning permission P/2010/2909 at this site (granted on appeal Ref: APP/A5270/A/10/2141217 dated 26/05/11) for minor material amendments (to modify the layout, form, design and appearance of the block of flats to match the design and appearance approved under planning permission P/2011/0539 dated 24/09/2012, to revise the housing mix within the block of flats to 2 x 1 bed, 17 x 2 bed and 1 x 3 bed,  to revise the energy strategy to comply with Code of Sustainable Homes Level 4 including the removal of the basement, and additional information provided on materials, construction methods, noise mitigation, hard and soft landscaping, boundary treatment, tree protection, renewable energy, affordable housing and highway visibility splays),  for demolition of existing building and erection of a part two, three and four storey building (with basement level) containing 20 flats (3 x 1 bed, 16 x 2 bed, and 1 x 3 bed), communal amenity space including roof gardens, car and cycle parking, refuse and recycling storage, and two terraces comprising 9 x 2 storey 3 bed houses (including semi-basements), private amenity space, associated landscaping and car parking with access achieved from Cherington Road
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the 26/05/2011.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers: 503-03 0101A, 503-03 0102A, 503-03 0103A, 503-03 0104A, 503-03 1100A, 503-03 1102A, 503-03 1103A, 503-03 1104A, 503-03 1105A, 503-03 1107A, 503-03 1108A, 503-03 2101A, 503-03 2102A, 503-03 3101A, 503-03 3102B, 503-03 3103A, 503-03 3104B, 503-03 3105B, 503-03 LP1E, 503-03 LP4C, 503-03 LP6A, 503-03 LP5C, 503-03 LP7A, 503-03 LP8B, 503-03 LP9D, 503-03 LP10B, 503-03 LP11B, 503-03 LP12A, 503-03 LP13B, Tree Report (prepared by ACD Arboriculture dated 14/04/2010 ref. ASHM17319tr), Arboricultural Implications Assessment (prepared by ACD Arboriculture dated 15/06/2010 ref. ASHM17319aia), Arboricultural Method Statement  (prepared by ACD Arboriculture dated 10/03/11 ref. ASHM17319amsA), Tree Protection Plan dated 9/3/11 ref: ASHM17319-03a), Tree Constraints Plan dated 14/04/10 ref: ASHM17319-01), Transport Statement (prepared by Royal Haskoning  dated July 2010 ref: 9V7539), Air Quality Assessment (prepared by Air Quality Consultants dated July 2010),  Junction Statement (prepared by Royal Haskoning dated November 2012 ref: 9Y0669), Affordable Housing Statement (dated 21/12/2012), Noise Impact Assessment (prepared by 24Acoustics dated 16/11/2012), Design and Access Statement rev A (prepared by Autor dated Oct 2012),  Luminaire Specification Duomo bollard, LV Distribution Schematic (prepared by Mendick Waring Ltd dated Jan 2013 ref: 1789-63-0G-SIT), Stela Lighting Specification, Illuma Lighting Specification, Demolition Method Statement (prepared by J. Harmes Demolition Ltd), Construction Method Statement Rev A (prepared by Francis Construction dated January 2013), Revised Energy Strategy (prepared by Mendick Waring Ltd dated October 2012), unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority.  Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding the submitted and approved plans and supporting information details of the materials and finishes to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before any part of the development is commenced (except demolition, site clearance and excavation below ground level). The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details, unless otherwise approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure that the materials and finishes harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 4.1, and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 3.5, 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | All planting, seeding and turfing comprised in the approved landscaping plans shall be carried out in the first planting and seeding seasons following the occupation of the buildings, or the completion of the development, whichever is the sooner; any trees or plants which within  period of 5 years from the completion of the development die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced in the next planting season with others of a similar size and species, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 3.2, 4.1, 4.5, and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 9, the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 3.6, 5.11, 7.4-7.6, and 7.21 of the London Plan (2011), the London Plan SPG on Chidren's Play and Recreation, and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | The parking spaces (including disabled parking) and internal cycle storage areas identified on the approved drawings, shall be marked out/provided on site prior to first occupation/use of any part of the development, and the spaces/cycle storage provision shall be kept continuously available for the life of the development and shall not be used for any other purpose unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for access to the site, manoeuvring within the site, and parking in accordance with policies 4.1, 9.1, 9.9 and 9.10 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 6.11, 6.12 and 6.14 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Each dwelling hereby permitted shall be constructed to achieve a minimum Code for Sustainable Homes Level 4 of the Code for Sustainable Homes (based on November 2010 Technical Guidance).  Within 3 months of the construction of the development (unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority), details of an 'Interim Design Stage' assessment and related certification should be submitted, and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Following the completion of the final dwelling, a Code for Sustainable Homes 'Post Construction Stage' assessment and related certification confirming the Code Level that has been achieved, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The approved measures and technologies to achieve the minimum Code for Sustainable Homes Level 4 standard and to ensure that the development is carbon neutral shall be implemented in accordance with the approval and thereafter shall be maintained in working order.   Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with policy 2.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies  5.1-5.7 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding the submitted Energy Strategy Report (Revision 1, October 2012), details of the sustainability measures to be incorporated into the development which demonstrates that the development will achieve an overall (minimum) reduction in carbon dioxide emissions of 25% (regulated carbon dioxide emissions) above Building Regulations 2010 shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development (except demolition, site clearance and excavation below ground level). The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details, which shall be completed prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved and thereafter permanently retained and maintained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason: To ensure that the development hereby approved is energy efficient and to contribute to the avoidance of need for new fossil fuel or other primary energy generation capacity and to reduce emissions of greenhouse gases,in accordance with policy 2.9 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies  5.1-5.7 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Part 1 Classes A to F of The Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2008 (or any other revoking and re-enacting Order with or without modification), no enlargement, improvement or alterations to the roof, porches, outbuildings or hard surfaces shall be carried out to the dwellings or their curtilages hereby permitted without the prior permission of the local planning authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site, to safeguard the living conditions of adjoining properties and visual appearance of the area, and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 9.1 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment'(2004), the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 6.11, 6.12, 6.14, 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | All residential dwellings hereby approved shall be constructed to the Lifetime Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To ensure that the development is accessible by all future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 7, policy 7.2 of The London Plan, the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and the National Planning Policy Framework. | The window louvres on the rear elevations of the houses shall be permanently retained.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with the objectives in accordance with policies 4.1, and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 3.5, 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) | Details of external lighting shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the first occupation of the development. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details, which shall be completed prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved and thereafter permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.    Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of occupiers of nearby properties and future occupiers of the site, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.12 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Before the first occupation of the apartment building hereby approved, its windows facing no. 5 Church Road shall be fitted with obscured glass and shall be permanently retained in that condition.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties, in accordance with policies 4.1, and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 3.5, 7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) | Details of the design of the building and car and cycle parking areas, hard and soft landscaping and bin storage areas to comply with the aims and objectives of Secured by Design and the Secured Car Parks Award shall be submitted to and Approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development (except demolition, site clearance and excavation below ground level). The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details, which shall be completed prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved and thereafter permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason: In the interest of the safety of the occupiers and visitors to the premises, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4 and 5.5 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 3.5, 7.3,7.4-7.6 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012) | Details of proposed and existing functional services above and below ground (e.g. drainage, power, communications cables, pipelines etc, indicating lines, manholes, supports etc) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development  (except demolition, site clearance and excavation below ground level). The development shall be implemented only in accordance with these approved details, unless otherwise approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: In the interests of providing adequate drainage and tree protection in accordance with policies 2.5, & 4.5 of the Adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), SPG 9, the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | An investigation and risk assessment to assess the nature and extent of any contamination on the site shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the commencement of the development (except demolition and site clearance). This assessment must be undertaken by a competent person, and shall assess any contamination on the site, whether or not it originates on the site. The report of the findings must include:   (i)	a survey of the extent, scale and nature of contamination;  (ii)	an assessment of the potential risks to human health. (iii)	an appraisal of remedial options, and proposal of the preferred option(s).   The approved remediation scheme must be carried out in accordance with its terms prior to the commencement of development (except demolition, site clearance and excavation below ground level required to carry out remediation), unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority. The local planning authority must be given two weeks written notification of commencement of the remediation scheme works.  Following completion of measures identified in the approved remediation scheme, a verification report that demonstrates the effectiveness of the remediation carried out must be submitted to and approved in writing local planning authority.  Reason: To protect the health and living conditions of residents in the area in accordance policies 2.7 and 4.1 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policy 5.13 of The London Plan, the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), and the National Planning Policy Framework, DEFRA and the Environment Agency's 'Model Procedures for the Management of Land Contamination, CLR 11, Environment Agency guidance 'Verification of Remediation of Land Contamination', Report: SC030114/R1'. | Details of the junction between the proposed service road and the highway, to include details of the proposed security pedestrian/vehicular gate and pedestrian visibility splays shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the first occupation of the development. The development shall be implemented only in accordance with the approved details, which shall be completed prior to the first occupation of the development hereby approved and thereafter permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.     Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for access to the site, manoeuvring within the site, and parking in accordance with policies 4.1, 9.1, 9.9 and 9.10 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 6.11, 6.12 and 6.14 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012). | Details of a car parking management plan to ensure that there are appropriate car parking enforcement measures on the site access roads shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to the first occupation of the development. The development shall be implemented only as approved and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority. Reason: To ensure that there is adequate provision for access to the site, manoeuvring within the site, and parking in accordance with policies 4.1, 9.1, 9.9 and 9.10 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 6.11, 6.12 and 6.14 of the London Plan (2011), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
